OneDSpec¶

class aspired.aspired.OneDSpec(science, wave_cal, standard=None, wave_cal_std=None, flux_cal=None)[source]¶

science: TwoDSpec object

wave_cal: WavelengthPolyFit object

standard: TwoDSpec object, optional

wave_cal_std: WavelengthPolyFit object, optional

flux_cal: StandardFlux object, optional (require wave_cal_std)

_set_fluxcal(flux_cal)[source]¶

Extract the required information from a StandardFlux object.

_set_standard(standard)[source]¶

Extract the required information from a TwoDSpec object

_set_wavecal(wave_cal, stype)[source]¶

Extract the required information from a WavelengthPolyFit object

apply_flux_calibration(stype='all')[source]¶

Apply the computed sensitivity curve

apply_wavelength_calibration(stype)[source]¶

Apply the wavelength calibration

compute_sencurve(kind=3, smooth=False, slength=5, sorder=3, display=False, renderer='default', jsonstring=False)[source]¶

Get the standard flux or magnitude of the given target and group based on the given array of wavelengths. Some standard libraries contain the same target with slightly different values.

kind: string or integer [1,2,3,4,5 only]

interpolation kind >>> [‘linear’, ‘nearest’, ‘zero’, ‘slinear’, ‘quadratic’, ‘cubic’,

‘previous’, ‘next’]

(default is ‘cubic’)

smooth: tuple

set to smooth the input ADU/flux/mag with scipy.signal.savgol_filter (default is True)

slength: int

SG-filter window size

sorder: int

SG-filter polynomial order

display: tuple, optional

Set to True to display disgnostic plot.

renderer: string, optional

plotly renderer options.

jsonstring: tuple, optional

set to True to return json string that can be rendered by Plotly in any support language.

A scipy interp1d object.

inspect_reduced_spectrum(stype='all', wave_min=4000.0, wave_max=8000.0, renderer='default', jsonstring=False)[source]¶

Display the reduced spectra.

inspect_sencurve(renderer='default', jsonstring=False)[source]¶

Display the computed sensitivity curve.
